### Constructor example

The following reference example uses placeholder values for all [input properties](#inputs).
<div>
<pulumi-chooser type="language" options="csharp,go,typescript,python,yaml,java"></pulumi-chooser>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">

```csharp
var userResource = new Credentials.User("userResource", new()
{
    Shared = new Credentials.Inputs.SharedArgs
    {
        Foo = "string",
    },
});
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">

```go
example, err := credentials.NewUser(ctx, "userResource", &credentials.UserArgs{
	Shared: &credentials.SharedArgs{
		Foo: pulumi.String("string"),
	},
})
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="java">

```java
var userResource = new User("userResource", UserArgs.builder()
    .shared(SharedArgs.builder()
        .foo("string")
        .build())
    .build());
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="python">

```python
user_resource = credentials.User("userResource", shared={
    "foo": "string",
})
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="typescript">

```typescript
const userResource = new credentials.User("userResource", {shared: {
    foo: "string",
}});
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="yaml">

```yaml
type: credentials:User
properties:
    shared:
        foo: string
```

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>
